This category belongs in the AI city build-out as well: 

‚Ä¢ Power Plants | $CEG, $VST, $NEE, $VRT, $EOSE
The city‚Äôs power stations & cooling plants that keep the lights on and the servers running.

I get this question all the time: is all this AI spend worth it?

Building the towers is the easy part. What matters now is how many tokens are actually flowing through the models every day (that‚Äôs the real measure of inference demand).

Without that steady flow of live workloads, you end up with skyline-rich but half-empty AI cities.

Stocks almost always retest the 200-day MA. 

After big runs in $HOOD, $PLTR, $OKLO, $ASTS, $RKLB, $IONQ, $IREN & $NBIS, pullbacks to support are natural.

FOMO tempts you to chase but markets come back. Patience is what Buffett built his career on.

Everyone‚Äôs sharing that triangle of $NVDA chips, $ORCL enterprise pipes & OpenAI models, but it overlooks how mispriced $GOOGL is.

Google already builds its own TPUs, trains frontier-scale models & controls the distribution arm but is still priced like just an ads business  ü§î
